intro: Debregeasia wallichiana, commonly known as the Kashmir saffron, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in high-altitude regions with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture and botanical gardens.
